title: Project-Based Language Learning Design Through Event-Based Knowledge Integration: Strengthening Communication Skills and Structured Learning Outcomes

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language proficiency (daily conversational level) and project-based learning experience, with comprehension of fundamental grammatical structures
context.additional_context: Collaborative project-based learning grounded in authentic language-use scenarios (role-plays, debates, presentations). Enhances writing and expressive abilities through learning journals and collaborative reports.

learning_goals: Learners will design and execute monthly language project events to enhance practical communication skills (integrated speaking, listening, reading, writing) in the target language
Learners will improve learning outcomes—including vocabulary expansion and grammar application—by ≥30% using event-based knowledge integration tools to resolve project-related challenges

Upon completing the 6-month course, learners will compile language knowledge acquired during projects (e.g., 150 specialized vocabulary items, 20 grammar rules) into structured learning journals (weekly entries, 24 total) and collaborative reports (1 per team), and present them for peer evaluation (≥3 feedbacks) and orientation sessions for subsequent learners
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
